Objects.Name: IPSO Digital Input
Objects.Description: Generic digital input for non-specific sensors

Resources.Name: Digital Input State
Resources.Description: The current state of a digital input

Resources.Name: Digital Input Counter
Resources.Description: The cumulative value of active state detected

Resources.Name: Digital Input Polarity
Resources.Description: The polarity of the digital input as a Boolean (0 \u003d Normal 1\u003d Reversed)

Resources.Name: Digital Input Debounce
Resources.Description: The debounce period in ms.

Resources.Name: Digital Input Counter Reset
Resources.Description: Reset the Counter value

Resources.Name: Sensor Type
Resources.Description: The type of the sensor (for instance PIR type)

Objects.Name: IPSO Digital Output
Objects.Description: Generic digital output for non-specific actuators

Resources.Name: Digital Output State
Resources.Description: The current state of a digital output

Resources.Name: Digital Output Polarity
Resources.Description: The polarity of a digital ouput as a Boolean (0 \u003d Normal 1\u003d Reversed)

Resources.Name: Application Type
Resources.Description: The application type of the output as a string for instance “LED”

Objects.Name: IPSO Analog Input
Objects.Description: Generic analog input for non-specific sensors

Resources.Name: Analog Input Current Value
Resources.Description: The current value of the analog input.

Resources.Name: Min Measured Value
Resources.Description: The minimum value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset

Resources.Name: Max Measured Value
Resources.Description: The maximum value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset

Resources.Name: Min Range Value
Resources.Description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Max Range Value
Resources.Description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Reset Min and Max Measured Values
Resources.Description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value

Resources.Name: Application Type
Resources.Description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string for instance “Air Pressure”

Resources.Name: Sensor Type
Resources.Description: The type of the sensor for instance PIR type

Objects.Name: IPSO Analog Output
Objects.Description: This IPSO object is a generic object that can be used with any kind of analog output interface.

Resources.Name: Min Range Value
Resources.Description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Max Range Value
Resources.Description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Analog Output Current Value
Resources.Description: The current state of the analogue output.

Resources.Name: Application Type
Resources.Description: If present the application type of the actuator as a string for instance “Thermostat”

Objects.Name: IPSO Generic Sensor
Objects.Description: This IPSO object allow the description of a generic sensor. It is based on the description of a value and a unit according to the UCUM specification. Thus any type of value defined within this specification can be reporting using this object. \nSpecific object for a given range of sensors is described later in the document enabling to identify the type of sensors directly from its Object ID. This object may be used as a generic object if a dedicated one does not exist. \n

Resources.Name: Min Measured Value
Resources.Description: The minimum value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset

Resources.Name: Max Measured Value
Resources.Description: The maximum value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset

Resources.Name: Min Range Value
Resources.Description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Max Range Value
Resources.Description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Reset Min and Max Measured Values
Resources.Description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value

Resources.Name: Sensor Value
Resources.Description: Last or Current Measured Value from the Sensor

Resources.Name: Sensor Units
Resources.Description: Measurement Units Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celsius.

Resources.Name: Application Type
Resources.Description: If present the application type of the sensor as a string for instance “CO2”

Resources.Name: Sensor Type
Resources.Description: The type of the sensor (for instance PIR type)

Resources.Name: Min Measured Value
Resources.Description: The minimum value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset

Resources.Name: Max Measured Value
Resources.Description: The maximum value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset

Resources.Name: Min Range Value
Resources.Description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Max Range Value
Resources.Description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Reset Min and Max Measured Values
Resources.Description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value

Resources.Name: Sensor Value
Resources.Description: The current value of the luminosity sensor.

Resources.Name: Sensor Units
Resources.Description: If present the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

Objects.Name: IPSO Presence
Objects.Description: Presence sensor with digital sensing optional delay parameters

Resources.Name: Digital Input State
Resources.Description: The current state of the presence sensor

Resources.Name: Digital Input Counter
Resources.Description: The cumulative value of active state detected.

Resources.Name: Digital Input Counter Reset
Resources.Description: Reset the Counter value

Resources.Name: Sensor Type
Resources.Description: The type of the sensor (for instance PIR type)

Resources.Name: Busy to Clear delay
Resources.Description: Delay from the detection state to the clear state in ms

Resources.Name: Clear to Busy delay
Resources.Description: Delay from the clear state to the busy state in ms

Objects.Name: IPSO Temperature
Objects.Description: Description: This IPSO object should be used with a temperature sensor to report a temperature measurement.  It also provides resources for minimum/maximum measured values and the minimum/maximum range that can be measured by the temperature sensor. An example measurement unit is degrees Celsius (ucum:Cel).

Resources.Name: Min Measured Value
Resources.Description: The minimum value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset

Resources.Name: Max Measured Value
Resources.Description: The maximum value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset

Resources.Name: Min Range Value
Resources.Description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Max Range Value
Resources.Description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Reset Min and Max Measured Values
Resources.Description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value

Resources.Name: Sensor Value
Resources.Description: Last or Current Measured Value from the Sensor

Resources.Name: Sensor Units
Resources.Description: Measurement Units Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celsius.

Objects.Name: IPSO Humidity
Objects.Description: Description: This IPSO object should be used with a humidity sensor to report a humidity measurement.  It also provides resources for minimum/maximum measured values and the minimum/maximum range that can be measured by the humidity sensor. An example measurement unit is relative humidity as a percentage (ucum:%).

Resources.Name: Min Measured Value
Resources.Description: The minimum value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset

Resources.Name: Max Measured Value
Resources.Description: The maximum value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset

Resources.Name: Min Range Value
Resources.Description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Max Range Value
Resources.Description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Reset Min and Max Measured Values
Resources.Description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value

Resources.Name: Sensor Value
Resources.Description: Last or Current Measured Value from the Sensor

Resources.Name: Sensor Units
Resources.Description: Measurement Units Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celsius.

Objects.Name: IPSO Power Measurement
Objects.Description: This IPSO object should be used over a power measurement sensor to report a remote power measurement.  It also provides resources for minimum/maximum measured values and the minimum/maximum range for both active and reactive power. Il also provides resources for cumulative energy calibration and the power factor.

Resources.Name: Reset Min and Max Measured Values
Resources.Description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value

Resources.Name: Instantaneous active power
Resources.Description: The current active power

Resources.Name: Min Measured active power
Resources.Description: The minimum active power measured by the sensor since it is ON

Resources.Name: Max Measured  active power
Resources.Description: The maximum active power measured by the sensor since it is ON

Resources.Name: Min  Range  active power
Resources.Description: The minimum active power that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Max Range active power
Resources.Description: The maximum active power that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Cumulative active power
Resources.Description: The cumulative active power since the last cumulative energy reset or device start

Resources.Name: Active Power Calibration
Resources.Description: Request an active power calibration by writing the value of a calibrated load.

Resources.Name: Instantaneous reactive power
Resources.Description: The current reactive power

Resources.Name: Min Measured reactive power
Resources.Description: The minimum reactive power measured by the sensor since it is ON

Resources.Name: Max Measured reactive power
Resources.Description: The maximum reactive power measured by the sensor since it is ON

Resources.Name: Min Range reactive power
Resources.Description: The minimum active power that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Max Range reactive power
Resources.Description: The maximum reactive power that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Cumulative reactive power
Resources.Description: The cumulative reactive power since the last cumulative energy reset or device start

Resources.Name: Reactive Power Calibration
Resources.Description: Request a reactive power calibration by writing the value of a calibrated load.

Resources.Name: Power factor
Resources.Description: If applicable the power factor of the current consumption.

Resources.Name: Current Calibration
Resources.Description: Read or Write the current calibration coefficient

Resources.Name: Reset Cumulative energy
Resources.Description: Reset both cumulative active/reactive power

Objects.Name: IPSO Actuation
Objects.Description: This IPSO object is dedicated to remote actuation such as ON/OFF action or dimming. A multi-state output can also be described as a string. This is useful to send pilot wire orders for instance. It also provides a resource to reflect the time that the device has been switched on.

Resources.Name: Application Type
Resources.Description: The Application type of the device for example “Motion Closure”.

Resources.Name: On/Off
Resources.Description: On/Off\n\n

Resources.Name: Dimmer
Resources.Description: This resource represents a light dimmer setting which has an Integer value between 0 and 100 as a percentage.

Resources.Name: On Time
Resources.Description: The time in seconds that the device has been on. Writing a value of 0 resets the counter.

Resources.Name: Muti-state Output
Resources.Description: A string describing a state for multiple level output such as Pilot Wire

Objects.Name: IPSO Set Point
Objects.Description: Description: This IPSO object should be used to set a desired value to a controller such as a thermostat. This object enables a setpoint to be expressed units defined in the UCUM specification to match an associated sensor or measurement value. A special resource is added to set the colour of an object.

Resources.Name: Units
Resources.Description: If present the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

Resources.Name: Colour
Resources.Description: A string representing a value in some color space

Resources.Name: Application Type
Resources.Description: The Application type of the device for example “Motion Closure”.

Resources.Name: Set Point Value
Resources.Description: The setpoint value.

Objects.Name: IPSO Load Control
Objects.Description: Description: This Object is used for demand-response load control and other load control in automation application (not limited to power).

Resources.Name: Event Identifier
Resources.Description: The event identifier as a string.

Resources.Name: Start Time
Resources.Description: Time when the load control event will start started.

Resources.Name: Duration In Min
Resources.Description: The duration of the load control event.

Resources.Name: Criticality Level
Resources.Description: The criticality of the event.  The device receiving the event will react in an appropriate fashion for the device.

Resources.Name: Avg Load Adj Pct
Resources.Description: Defines the maximum energy usage of the receivng device as a percentage of the device\u0027s normal maximum energy usage.

Resources.Name: Duty Cycle
Resources.Description: Defines the duty cycle for the load control event i.e what percentage of time the receiving device is allowed to be on.

Objects.Name: IPSO Light Control
Objects.Description: Description: This Object is used to control a light source such as a LED or other light.  It allows a light to be turned on or off and its dimmer setting to be control as a % between 0 and 100. An optional colour setting enables a string to be used to indicate the desired colour.

Resources.Name: Sensor Units
Resources.Description: If present the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

Resources.Name: Colour
Resources.Description: A string representing a value in some color space

Resources.Name: Cumulative active power
Resources.Description: The total power in Wh that the light has used.

Resources.Name: Power factor
Resources.Description: The power factor of the light.

Resources.Name: On/Off
Resources.Description: This resource represents a light which can be controlled the setting of which is a Boolean value (10) where 1 is on and 0 is off.

Resources.Name: Dimmer
Resources.Description: This resource represents a light dimmer setting which has an Integer value between 0 and 100 as a percentage.

Resources.Name: On Time
Resources.Description: The time in seconds that the light has been on. Writing a value of 0 resets the counter.

Objects.Name: IPSO Power Control
Objects.Description: Description: This Object is used to control a power source such as a Smart Plug.  It allows a power relay to be turned on or off and its dimmer setting to be control as a % between 0 and 100.

Resources.Name: Cumulative active power
Resources.Description: The total power in Wh that has been used by the load.

Resources.Name: Power factor
Resources.Description: The power factor of the load.

Resources.Name: On/Off
Resources.Description: This resource represents a power relay which can be controlled the setting of which is a Boolean value (10) where 1 is on and 0 is off.

Resources.Name: Dimmer
Resources.Description: This resource represents a power dimmer setting which has an Integer value between 0 and 100 as a percentage.

Resources.Name: On Time
Resources.Description: The time in seconds that the power relay has been on. Writing a value of 0 resets the counter.

Objects.Name: IPSO Accelerometer
Objects.Description: Description: This IPSO object can be used to represent a 1-3 axis accelerometer.

Resources.Name: Min Range Value
Resources.Description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Max Range Value
Resources.Description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Sensor Units
Resources.Description: Measurement Units Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celsius.

Resources.Name: X Value
Resources.Description: The measured value along the X axis.

Resources.Name: Y Value
Resources.Description: The measured value along the Y axis.

Resources.Name: Z Value
Resources.Description: The measured value along the Z axis.

Objects.Name: IPSO Magnetometer
Objects.Description: Description: This IPSO object can be used to represent a 1-3 axis magnetometer with optional compass direction.

Resources.Name: Sensor Units
Resources.Description: Measurement Units Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celsius.

Resources.Name: X Value
Resources.Description: The measured value along the X axis.

Resources.Name: Y Value
Resources.Description: The measured value along the Y axis.

Resources.Name: Z Value
Resources.Description: The measured value along the Z axis.

Resources.Name: Compass Direction
Resources.Description: The compass direction

Objects.Name: IPSO Barometer
Objects.Description: Description: This IPSO object should be used with an air pressure sensor to report a barometer measurement.  It also provides resources for minimum/maximum measured values and the minimum/maximum range that can be measured by the barometer sensor. An example measurement unit is kPa (ucum:kPa).

Resources.Name: Min Measured Value
Resources.Description: The minimum value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset

Resources.Name: Max Measured Value
Resources.Description: The maximum value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset

Resources.Name: Min Range Value
Resources.Description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Max Range Value
Resources.Description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor

Resources.Name: Reset Min and Max Measured Values
Resources.Description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value

Resources.Name: Sensor Value
Resources.Description: Last or Current Measured Value from the Sensor

Resources.Name: Sensor Units
Resources.Description: If present the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.
